root.title: Aldyi-Bel I (e-12)
root.place: The first stone found in the hole Aldyy-Bel near the valley of Kuli-Kem in 8 km from its merge with Ulug-Kem (the second stone is е-72).
root.store: Made of four-sided greenish slate. Considerably destroyed by wind. The surface of the stone is not polished.
root.general: Жасыл түсті сланецтен жасалған бітіктас. Желмен беті қатты бұзылған. Тастың беті тегістелмеген. Төрт қатар жазу бар.
root.description: There are inscriptions on four sides of the stele: 1 line in each, totally 4 lines consists of 50 signs. It is possible to read through only I, IV lines now. II, III lines are erased. Those lines are considered in earlier sources.
root.investigation: Aspelin found in 1888 following the message of Safiyanov. Klements 449 investigated in 1981 and made a copy. Researchers of Sayan-Tuva expedition (СТЭАН: Batmanov) investigated in 1965.
